briefTitle: Obesity and Asthma: Nutrigenetic Response to Omega-3 Fatty Acids

armGroups.label: omega-3 fatty acids
interventionNames: Dietary Supplement: omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age 12-25
* BMI \> 25 (age 18-25) or BMI%\>85th (age 12-17) (BMI Liberalized)
* Physician diagnosis of persistent asthma
* Lung function responsiveness by bronchodilator reversibility or bronchoprovocation testing

Exclusion Criteria:

* pregnancy
* currently taking LTRA for asthma control
* other serious chronic medical condition
* bleeding diathesis

outcomeMeasures.title: Asthma Control Questionnaire (Juniper)
outcomeMeasures.description: The ACQ ranges from 0 to 6 (higher values indicate worse asthma control). A score greater than 1.25 in children is considered poor asthma control, and a change of 0.4 or greater is considered clinical meaningful.

outcomeMeasures.title: N3-to-n6 PUFA Ratio (Granulocytes)
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio of total omega-3 to total omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids from granulocytes in peripheral blood

outcomeMeasures.title: N3-to-n6 PUFA Ratio (Monocytes)
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio of total omega-3 to total omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids from monocytes in peripheral blood

outcomeMeasures.title: Asthma Control Test
outcomeMeasures.description: The asthma control test assesses patient reported symptoms from the prior month and has a range from 5 to 25 with a higher score suggesting better asthma control.

outcomeMeasures.title: Urinary Leukotriene-E4
outcomeMeasures.description: Leukotriene E4 obtained from urine was measured using liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry.

outcomeMeasures.title: FEV1
outcomeMeasures.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second is a validated spirometry measure.

outcomeMeasures.title: Exacerbations
outcomeMeasures.description: Exacerbations of asthma were defined by the need for urgent medical care (emergency room or urgent care clinic) or systemic corticosteroids to avoid severe worsening of asthma determined by study physician or local provider

outcomeMeasures.title: Phone Contacts
outcomeMeasures.description: Phone contact was defined as an urgent or unscheduled phone contact to a medical provider for asthma
